No willful contrivances, no stereotypes, every onär sings as equals and plays with or without inhibitions all the characters except the tragic hero of limited abilities Henry Eldridge who is played with sensitivity

Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. There were some good fight moves in there that got you interested, other than that the movie was pretty slow for me. However, Christine Javier is very beautiful and along with her athleticism and physical strength she really does deliver quite cutely. Not a disaster!

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Some people may disagree with me on this title, saying that the story is way to hateful to be enjoyable and that the characters are too vulgar, but if you think about it, isn’t all human behaviour hateful at a certain point in their lives?
